This returns the storage slot used by the implementation. It is used to validate the implementation's compatibility when performing an upgrade. IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier."},"removeChannel((uint64,uint8))":{"params":{"channel":"The channel to remove."}},"renounceRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `account`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event."},"revokeRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. params.broadcastModule: The address of the `BroadcastModule` contract for the channel.

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleGranted} event.

params.guardian: The address of the guardian contract.
params.timelock: The address of the timelock contract.
params.unfreeze: The address of the unfreeze contract.

proxiableUUID().details: Implementation of the ERC1822 {proxiableUUID} function. This returns the storage slot used by the implementation. It is used to validate the implementation's compatibility when performing an upgrade. IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier.

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `account`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

params.broadcastParamsList: The parameters to use for each channel.
params.channels: The channels to send the update over.
params.pmmrSize: The size of the PMMR to send the update for.

params.broadcastParamsList: The parameters to use for each channel.
params.channels: The channels to send the update over.
params.mmrPeaks: The peaks of the MMR corresponding to the PMMR, ordered so that `mmrPeaks[i]`                 is a Merkle root of `2 ** i` block hashes.
params.pmmrSize: The size of the PMMR to extend.

upgradeTo(address).details: Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event.

upgradeToAndCall(address,bytes).details: Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`, and subsequently execute the function call encoded in `data`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event.

AXIOM_ROLE().notice: Storage slot for the addresses with the permission of different Axiom versions.

GUARDIAN_ROLE().notice: Storage slot for the addresses with the permission of a 'guardian'.

PROVER_ROLE().notice: Storage slot for the addresses with the permission of a 'prover'.

TIMELOCK_ROLE().notice: Storage slot for the address with the permission of a 'timelock'.

UNFREEZE_ROLE().notice: Storage slot for the addresses with the permission of a 'unfreezer'.

addChannel((uint64,uint8),address).notice: Add an available channel for message passing.         Because the `BroadcastModule` in each channel is allowed to modify contract         storage or self-destruct via `delegatecall`, each channel added must be trusted         to _not_ do so.

constructor.notice: Prevents the implementation contract from being initialized outside of the upgradeable proxy.

freezeAll().notice: Set the contract state to frozen, which will disable a set of security-sensitive functions.         Intended only for use in reaction to an unforeseen vulnerability in ZK circuits or smart contracts.

removeChannel((uint64,uint8)).notice: Remove an available channel for message passing.

sendBlockhashPmmr(uint32,(uint64,uint8)[.notice: Send an already checkpointed PMMR update over a set of channels.

sendLatestBlockhashPmmr(uint32,bytes32[].notice: Extend a checkpointed PMMR from AxiomV2Core and send over a set of channels.

unfreezeAll().notice: Set the contract state to unfrozen, which re-enables a set of security-sensitive functions.         Intended for use after any vulnerability or potential vulnerability leading to a freeze is fixed.

@custom:oz-upgrades-unsafe-allow constructor
 @notice Prevents the implementation contract from being initialized outside of the upgradeable proxy.

@title AxiomV2Broadcaster
 @notice Contract that broadcasts snapshots of blockhash PMMRs from AxiomV2Core to other chains.
